full_threads.body:
Hey Jen,

Stepping in for Allie—thanks again for the extra context. Based on your description, this does seem like an isolated issue. As said, we tried to replicate it on our end but weren’t able to reproduce the same behavior.

That said, a quick workaround that might help:
  • Pasting the text without formatting (also known as plain pasting). On a Mac, you can do this by pressing Shift + Option + Command + V instead of the usual paste shortcut. This strips out any hidden formatting that might be causing the issue.

If the issue keeps happening or becomes more disruptive, don’t hesitate to reach out—we’re always happy to help however we can.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi Allie,

Thanks for looking into this. It happens randomly and happens on every quote. The text could be copied from an email, but it only happens to Lea not me even though I do the same thing.

Warm regards,

Jen Lovegrove

Hi Jen,

Thank you so much for your patience while we looked into this!

Here’s where we’re at so far:
  • We tried to replicate the issue on our end, but couldn’t quite get the same result.
  • From what we can tell, the extra letters look like a Unicode artifact, this sometimes happens when text is copied and pasted from another document.

    To help us troubleshoot further, would you mind sharing:
    • The specific document or an example where it occurred
    • Whether it always happens in the same spot, or only occasionally

Having that info will really help us dig in and experiment a bit more on our side.

Thanks again for flagging this, Jen, we really appreciate it!

Please let us know when it’s convenient, and as always, happy to help with anything else you need.

Perfect thanks Allie 😊

Warm regards,

Jen Lovegrove

I’ll keep you posted either way!
